item.title: Report E-2023090388
item.description:
Report E-2023090388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and secure the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-ounces of material released to the tote lid due to a loose cap. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The cap was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090386
item.description:
Report E-2023090386

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced a NA1993 EC5627A release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and securement of the tote. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of material released to the tote body down all four sides and a 4” x 4” area of the dock floor due to a loose gasket. The released product was wiped up using simple green and absorbent rags. The gasket was re-secured, and a slosh test was conducted to ensure there would no longer be a release in transit. The waste rags were then containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023081680
item.description:
Report X-2023081680

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON INSPECTION OF THE PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND THAT THE BOX WAS TORN DUE TO HOW CORRODED IT WAS. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE SIX BOTTLES HAD A SMALL CRACK ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE WHICH RESULTED IN THE SMALL LEAK. ALL OTHER BOTTLES HAD A REACTION TO THE LEAKING BOTTLE WHICH DAMAGED WHOLE SHIPMENT. DescribePack: CONTAINER DURABILITY DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A TOTE

item.title: Report X-2023081678
item.description:
Report X-2023081678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081678 SequenceEvent: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND TORN WITH ALL BOTTLES OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ONE OUT OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A BROKEN SEAL AND NO CAP WHICH RESULTED IN THE SPILLAGE OF THE WHOLE BOTTLE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A TOTE. 2. X-2023081684 SequenceEvent: one container leaked the seal on box opened and lost other container. Box may have been placed upside down, wet marking deteriorated top. DescribePack: 12 x 12 top deteriorated DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent & plastic bag.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNPROCESSED AND WRONGFULLY REPACKTED RTS HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE UNMARKED AND WET ON BOTTOM. SPIDR INDICATES PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AT SFRN NC BELT. PACKAGE WAS REPACKED AND RTS WITHOUT MARKINGS. PACKAGE NOW HAS OVERHEAD SCANS AT SACR DUE TO LACK OF MARKINGS. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM SMALL PINHOLE FROM AN IMPACT. FOUR TENTHS OF A GALLON LOSS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023081541
item.description:
Report X-2023081541

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package submitted wet on 1 side with blue staining on the outer box. Inside is a white box with a diamond LQ label on it. Inside that was 4 qty of 1 Gallon plastic container of Pond Champs Algae X, with 1 dented, cap loose, and leaked internally. DescribePack: Package was dented in the middle of its body. Cap was loose by 1 full turn. Seal was open by a quarter of an inch. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic lined container. No spill was seen around the package to be wiped.

item.title: Report X-2023081540
item.description:
Report X-2023081540

  • City: OCEANSIDE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was submitted for inspection because it got wet from another package. Inside, found a ripped bag of 50 lbs. Copper Sulfate Pentahydrate with its content spilled inside the outer box. DescribePack: A 7 in rip was found on the top part of the bag just near the seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill happened inside of the outer packaging. Then a spill happened during inspection which was immediately swept up and put back in the outer packaging.

When discovered PH Neutralizer was put on all of the spilled liquid and the pail was put into a lined damaged hazardous materials tote to stop any further leakage. DescribePack: The lid was not on tightly causing the liquid to spill when the package fell. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined damaged hazardous materials tote.

item.title: Report I-2023090042
item.description:
Report I-2023090042

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: Santa Clara
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Around 6:30am, the yard personnel were in the process of transferring containers to different trailers when they noticed a tote that might have a possible leak around the valve. They prepped an empty tote in the event there was a need to transfer the material out of the tote. Once they were all prepped, they checked the valve handle to make sure it was fully in the closed position. When the outlet cap was unscrewed, the material shot out of the valve due to a missing ball valve. Over half of the material was captured in the second tote and approximately 125 gals of the material released to the asphalt around the load dock. There was no release to the environment. The yard team quickly controlled the release with berms, absorbents, and vermiculite/floor dry and proceeded to clean up the material.

item.title: Report X-2023090013
item.description:
Report X-2023090013

  • City: ONTARIO

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ONTARIO, CALIFORNIA, AN AIR PACKAGE WITH A VISIBLE PACKING LIST DISPLAYING AN E-SCOOTER DESCIPTION AND ADDITIONAL PREPRINTED PHANTOMGOGO MODEL R1 DESCRIPTIVE INFORMATION WAS STOPPED FOR CONTENT INSPECTION. INNER CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALED ONE PHANTOM R1 ELECTRIC SCOOTER WITH A LITHIUM ION BATTERY INSTALLED IN THE SCOOTER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN.

item.title: Report X-2023061322
item.description:
Report X-2023061322

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: STOCKTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2023 06 21 this HAZMAT shipment was observed leaking during deramping at that Stockton Intermodal Facility. Unit was placed in the hazpit for safekeeping until remediation was complete. Hazmat One was notified and they dispatched Patriot Environmental to inspect and remediate. Contractor arrived on property at approximately 13:00 to begin remediation. Upon exterior inspection, contractor observed a liquid, with a strong odor leaking at a rate of 4 5 drops per minute from the rear right corner of the trailer. Leaking liquid appears to be evaporating shortly after hitting the ground. Once door was opened, contractor observed a shipment of mixed freight, which included two pallets of metal drums loaded at the rear. Both pallets shifted toward the door, coming to rest against a load bar, which caused damage to four drums (two of which are leaking and identified in attached photos). It is estimated that a total of 2 quarts of product leaked from two drums. Product is identified as UN1247 // METHYL METHACRYLATE MONOMER, STABILIZED.

item.title: Report X-2023060815
item.description:
Report X-2023060815

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GBRX 702552 identified with release from top of car. BNSF Mechanical responders identified and secured 3 of 8 man way swing bolts to secure the release. The gasket was inspected for integrity and was found to be in a serviceable condition.
